definition: to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity

sentences.chinese: 突然之間我們感到害臊。

sentences.english: Well, now, Jim, I've lived that rough as you'd be ashamed to hear of.
sentences.chinese: 你瞧，吉姆，我過的這種苦日子連你聽了都會害臊。

sentences.english: I am utterly ashamed of you.
These kids ought to feel ashamed of themselves for such a free-for-all in public.
sentences.chinese: 這些孩子在大庭廣衆這樣大吵大鬧真是該感到害臊。

sentences.english: And people were so immodest as to marry in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 人們不因在家中成婚而害臊。

sentences.english: I was heartily ashamed of my hastiness.
sentences.chinese: 我從內心裏爲我的倉促而害臊。

sentences.english: Tomorrow I'll go back to tell him off: I'll make his ears burn for a week!
sentences.chinese: 明天，我得去罵他，我得讓他一個禮拜都感到害臊。

sentences.english: Your behaviour makes me blush for your poor wife.
sentences.chinese: 你的行爲使我爲你可憐的妻子害臊。

sentences.english: Aren’t you ashamed to act like that in front of the doctor?
sentences.chinese: 你在大夫面前這樣不覺得害臊嗎？

sentences.english: Job told him he ought to be ashamed of himself.
sentences.chinese: 約伯對他說他應該感到害臊。

definition: to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to have no sense of shame
